Pre-Game Insights: The Westfallonstadion in Dortmund is known for its electrifying atmosphere.
Germany flew under the radar ahead of the tournament but have been unbeaten and qualified for the knockout stages with a game to spare.
Julian Nagelsmann's side have let their football do all the talking so far.
There is real belief that Germany, led by rising stars like Florian Wirtz and Jamal Musiala, as well as Toni Kroos on his swan song, can secure a record fourth Euros triumph.
The focus now must be on beating Denmark to reach the quarter-finals, where Spain may lie in wait.
Denmark also boasts an unbeaten record but has scored just twice and is yet to win a game.

Twelve years on from Germany's 2-1 victory in the round of 16 and 32 since the Danes beat West Germany in the final, the current sides get a chance to write their own chapter in the pair's Euros history.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Germany v Denmark will take place on Saturday 29th June 2024.
Germany v Denmark will kick off at 8pm.
Germany v Denmark will be shown live on ITV1 with live coverage from 7:15pm.
You can also live stream Germany v Denmark online via ITVX.
You can listen to the match on BBC Radio 5 Live.
